intro: Neurolepis virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. Neurolepis virgata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. It thrives in full sun and requires minimal water once established.
